text: The Drents Museum () is an art and history museum in Assen, Drenthe, the Netherlands. It opened in 1854. It has a collection of prehistoric artifacts and art works. In 2023, it had 179,345 visitors. On 25 January 2025, thieves broke into the museum with explosives and stole golden artifacts, including the Helmet of Coțofenești. ==References== Category:1854 establishments in Europe Category:19th-century establishments in the Netherlands Category:Museums in the Netherlands Category:Assen
title: Drents Museum
